result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Miotke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Associated with Charge #1
filed by defendant/counsel

Defendant Anthony M Miotke in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek. Clifford Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed electronically, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, concurrent to Fond du Lac County Case 16 CF 86, 60 days jail to commence forthwith, concurrent to 16 CF 86 (Fond du Lac County Case), $518.00 costs, AODA and comply, defendant to submit DNA Sample, 6 month D.L. suspension, 2 days sentence credit,
filed by Atty Burdon
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
from Atty Burdon to Columbia County Sheriff's Dept re: cancellation of warrant

Defendant, Anthony M Miotke, appeared by video from New Lisbon Correctional with Atty. Riek in the courtroom. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on July 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Warrant issued due to Defendant's failure to appear for court hearing/pretrial on Jan. 7, 2016

Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared for the defendant. Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin, motioned for a warrant. Atty. Riek stated defendant did not have a ride for today. Warrant authorized. Stayed until Tuesday at noon. Court granted Atty. Riek's motion for defendant to appear at 2:45 on Monday to do a waiver of preliminary hearing.

Notice of Hearing RE: Preliminary Hearing 01-07-2016 at 9:00 in Branch 1 Filed 12-16-2015, mailed to Anthony M Miotke 426 Femrite Dr. Madison WI 53716, returned as undeliverable. "Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward." Email to Atty Riek notifying her of the above, cc: DA's office as well as victim witness. Per email reply, Defendant is aware of the hearing. No change in address to report per Atty Riek.
